Class Bullet

java.lang.Object
Entity
Bullet
public class Bullet extends Entity
Projectile entity fired by the player.

A bullet moves horizontally, is removed when it hits a solid map block or an enemy, or once it exceeds its maximum travel distance.

Author:
psyjr14

    • Bullet

      public Bullet(int x, int y, javafx.scene.image.Image bulletImage)
      Constructs a new bullet at the given position.
      Parameters:
      x - initial x-position in pixels
      y - initial y-position in pixels
      bulletImage - sprite used to render the bullet

  • Method Details

    • update

      public boolean update(List<Enemy> enemies, List<MapBlock> blocks)
      Updates bullet movement and resolves collisions.

      The bullet advances by its current speed unless the next position would collide with a map block or an enemy. If the bullet hits something or travels beyond its maximum range, this method returns true to indicate removal.

      Parameters:
      enemies - list of enemies to test collision against
      blocks - list of map blocks used for collision detection
      Returns:
      true if the bullet should be removed; false if it remains active

    • copy

      public Bullet copy(int newX, int newY)
      Creates a temporary bullet copy used to test collisions before applying movement.
      Overrides:
      copy in class Entity
      Parameters:
      newX - x-position for the copy
      newY - y-position for the copy
      Returns:
      a new Bullet instance representing the predicted position

    • travelledDistance

      public double travelledDistance()
      Computes the distance travelled from the startPoint to the current position.
      Returns:
      Euclidean distance travelled in pixels

    • collidesEnemy

      public boolean collidesEnemy(List<Enemy> enemies)
      Checks for collision with any enemy. If a hit occurs, the enemy is damaged.
      Parameters:
      enemies - list of enemies to test collision against
      Returns:
      true if this bullet intersects at least one enemy
